alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:30AM CST until January 28 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois and Indiana... Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Iroquois and Newton Counties. Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. Kankakee River at Momence affecting Kankakee County. Vermilion River near Leonore affecting La Salle County. Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Newton and Lake (IN) Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar Creek from near Milford downstream to the confluence with the Iroquois River at Watseka, including the Milford gauge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, structures are threatened in southwest Milford. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Saturday, the river stage was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling thereafter. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: River rises are being affected by significant river ice cover and by snowmelt. Significant river ice cover can lead to ice jams that cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. A Flood Warning means that water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 430 AM CST.
